content.text:
I'll help you get familiar with the codebase structure. Let me start by exploring the repository to understand its layout and components.

<Bash>
ls -la
</Bash>

<Bash>
find . -type f -name "*.svelte" | head -20
</Bash>

<Bash>
find . -type f -name "*.ts" -o -name "*.js" | head -20
</Bash>

<Bash>
tree -I node_modules -I dist -I '.git' -L 3
</Bash>

Let me also check the main configuration files to understand the project setup:

<Read>
/Users/juliani/repos/svelte5/wiki/package.json
</Read>

<Read>
/Users/juliani/repos/svelte5/wiki/tsconfig.json
</Read>

<Read>
/Users/juliani/repos/svelte5/wiki/vite.config.ts
</Read>

Now let me check the modified file to see what's been changed:

<Read>
/Users/juliani/repos/svelte5/wiki/docs/notes.md
</Read>

And let me explore the main src directory structure:

<Bash>
find src -type f | head -20
</Bash>

Based on this exploration, here's what I can tell you about this Svelte 5 wiki project:

## Project Structure
This is a Svelte 5 wiki application with the following key directories:
- `src/` - Main source code directory
- `docs/` - Documentation and notes
- Various configuration files for TypeScript, Vite, etc.

## Key Components Found
Multiple `.svelte` components, indicating this is a rich interactive application with:
- Block-related components
- Menu and UI components
- Editor-related functionality

## Recent Changes
The `docs/notes.md` file has been modified recently, which may contain documentation about recent feature development.

## Technology Stack
- Svelte 5 (latest version)
- TypeScript
- Vite as the build tool
- Modern JavaScript/TypeScript development setup

The project appears to be an editor or wiki application with sophisticated UI components including bubble menus, inline menus, and block actions - suggesting it might be a rich text editor or similar interactive application.

Would you like me to explore any specific part of the codebase in more detail?
